# Vapor Web Framework Documentation

## Summary
Vapor is a web framework for Swift, enabling development of backends, web apps, APIs, and HTTP servers using Swift's modern, safe, and powerful language features.

## Key Sections

### Getting Started
- Installation (macOS and Linux)
- Hello World tutorial
- Folder structure
- SwiftPM integration
- Xcode support

### Basics
- Routing system
- Controllers
- Content handling (encoding/decoding)
- HTTP client
- Validation
- Async operations
- Logging
- Environment configuration
- Error handling

### Fluent ORM
- Model definitions
- Relationships
- Migrations
- Query builder
- Transactions
- Schema management

### Template Engine (Leaf)
- Template syntax
- Custom tag support

### Data Storage
- Redis caching
- Session management

### Advanced Features
- Middleware
- Testing framework
- Server configuration
- File handling
- CLI commands
- Queue system
- WebSockets
- Services and dependency injection
- Request lifecycle
- APNS (Apple Push Notification Service)
- Distributed tracing

### Security
- Authentication
- Cryptography
- Password management
- JWT (JSON Web Tokens)

### Deployment
- DigitalOcean
- Fly.io
- Heroku
- Supervisor
- Systemd
- Nginx
- Docker
